definition: surname Li/abbr. for 禮記|礼记[Li3 ji4], Classic of Rites
sufferings brought about by Confucian ethics

sentences.english: He proposed to rebuild ethical education, by neatening customs to save Xanadu civilization.
sentences.chinese: 倡言重建礼教，整顿风俗，保存华夏文明。

sentences.english: It was the feudal rules and patriarch moral that led to their tragical fates.
sentences.chinese: 是封建礼教和宗法道德筑就了她们的悲剧命运。

sentences.english: Deuteronomy 18:9 commands Israelites not to copy the toevah of other nations.
sentences.chinese: 申命记18:09命令以色列人不要模仿他国的礼教。

sentences.english: He also led the Maronite Tribunal.
sentences.chinese: 此外，他还肩负马龙礼教会法庭的领导工作。

sentences.english: It only made limitedly adaptation in the foundation of feudal ethics and rites.
sentences.chinese: 它不过是在封建礼教基础上作出了有限的变通而已。

sentences.english: The other is to use the powerful "Great East Asian Sphere Order" to replace the traditional "Sino-centric sphere of order".
sentences.chinese: 二是以武威“大东亚秩序”来取代礼教“华夷秩序”。
家，在中国，是礼教的堡垒。

definition: three principles and five virtues (idiom)/the three rules (ruler guides subject, father guides son and husband guides wife) and five constant virtues of Confucianism (benevolence 仁, righteousness 義|义, propriety 禮|礼, wisdom 智 and fidelity 信)

Confucian moral injunctions for women, namely: obey in turn three men father, husband and son, plus the four virtues of morality 德, physical charm 容, propriety in speech 言 and efficiency in needlework 功
the teaching of Confucius and Mencius
to regard men as superior to women (idiom)
Confucian school, founded by Confucius 孔子[Kong3 zi3] (551-479 BC) and Mencius 孟子[Meng4 zi3] (c. 372-c. 289 BC)
sense of propriety, justice, integrity and honor (i.e. the four social bonds, 四維|四维[si4 wei2])
